Melville MUDLib Security Patch for version 0.9

Note that this patch is relevant to version 0.9 only, and will be obsoleted when version 0.9.1 is released. Do not apply it to later versions, apply only with care to earlier versions.

To install:

  • Replace your existing /system/auto/security.c with this one.
  • With these new changes, certain files that need to be readable by unprivileged users are unusable. Create a new directory for them. The recommended name is /doc/news. You can pick a different name if you prefer.
  • Move the three files from /data/system to /doc/news. The files are called news, welcome and new_player.
  • Change the MUDLib /data/system references to say your new directory name (/doc/news) instead. There are three references you'll need to change: one each in /system/user.c, /system/user/login.c and /system/player/creation.c.
  • Enjoy your new, more secure MUDLib.

Noah Gibbs
